channel.title: Mastodon Home Timeline
channel.description: RSS feed for the Mastodon Home timeline

item.title: Matteo Carandini
item.description:
It's high time US universities stop this absurdity.
https://www.nytimes.com/2023/07/03/us/harvard-alumni-children-affirmative-action.html?smid=nytcore-android-share

item.title: Heidy Khlaaf (هايدي خلاف)
item.description: The rate limiting incident in Twitter isn't really what pushed me over to use Mastodon more and more. Currently there is a hashtag on Twitter related to the French riots that's calling on the expulsion of all Muslim, African, and Arab immigrants from the entirety of Europe. The trending hashtag (at #2) is filled with images encouraging mass killings and lynchings of Arabs. There is no come back from this.

item.title: Eugen Rochko
item.description: So, weekend tally: The number of active users across Mastodon rose by 294K, and posting activity roughly tripled. Lots of new sign-ups, but also many returning users. Fun times!

item.title: Uncle Duke
item.description: the idea of being visited by aliens lost its appeal when i realized they’d likely just be some other planet’s asshole billionaires

item.title: Sainsbury Wellcome Centre
item.description: We are excited to share that Dr Julia Harris will join SWC as a Group Leader in January.The research conducted in the Harris lab will follow the activity of individual neurons across cycles of wake and sleep. The team will examine the cellular mechanisms involved in sleep-mediated circuit reorganisation and how these changes influence and refine behaviour across repeated cycles of wake and sleep. Find out more: https://www.sainsburywellcome.org/web/research-news/julia-harris-open-sleep-lab-swc

item.title: Gina Poe
item.description: Hey Mastodon users! This is my first post as I just opened my account migrating from @doctorpoe on twitter. I hope to find my old friends and make new ones among the mastodon conoscenti.

item.title: Robert Reich
item.description: Total student loan debt that would have been erased for millions of Americans: $400 billionTotal cost of the Trump tax cuts that largely benefited the wealthy and corporations: $1.9 trillionThis is what I mean when I say the system is rigged.

item.title: Thiago Carvalho
item.description: 'It was also that New York University was forced to close all its overseas courses as a result of the catastrophic farrago.'cc @schoppik https://literaryreview.co.uk/the-students-who-went-to-sea

item.title: James Briscoe
item.description:
ICYMI: Recordings of a fantastic symposium organised by the inimitable Denis Duboule on 'Developmental Timing'Jean Leon Maitre
Thomas Gregor
Claude Desplan
Pierre Vanderhaeghen
Olivier Pourquie
& yours trulyhttps://www.college-de-france.fr/fr/agenda/colloque/les-temps-du-developpement-embryonnaire

item.title: Thiago Carvalho
item.description: "What could possibly go wrong? More than three hundred overprivileged American students travelling the world on a hastily converted troopship, led by a recently sacked university professor determined to prove that travel could be as educational as any university course and keen to make money in the process."https://literaryreview.co.uk/the-students-who-went-to-sea

item.title: ADHDean
item.description: I’ve been working at this pastry shop longer than anyone else. It’s because of all the turnover.

item.title: Ricki Tarr
item.description: It might be nice to call out some people who are doing good work for other people, doesn't have to be political.I've always admired Rep Katie Porter, watching her stand up to corporate bullies has always been a delight.

item.title: Gaspar Jekely
item.description:
In our new preprint we characterise neuropeptide signalling in the cnidarian #Nematostella.
https://www.biorxiv.org/content/10.1101/2023.07.03.547448v1
Daniel Thiel and Luis Yanez-Guerra screened 64 neuropeptides against 161 G-protein coupled receptors (#GPCR) and found activating peptide ligands for 31 receptors.
#cnidaria #neuropeptide #evolution #neuroscience

item.title: George Constantinides
item.description:
Applications for Imperial College Research Fellowships are now open! This is a great opportunity for early career researchers to begin an independent research career. Please share.https://www.imperial.ac.uk/research-and-innovation/research-office/funder-information/research-fellowships/icrf/Our dedicated postdoc and fellows development centre has online briefings you can attend to learn more (but you don't need to attend to apply). For all: https://imperial.eu.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_eFnlcD3P2NUSw0mFor BAME candidates: https://imperial.eu.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_9mHYazFxxrwfxR4For women:
https://imperial.eu.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_03rO9Lv5OjkkRls

item.description: High Value Tea Towel.

item.title: Blake Richards
item.description: ** Job Advert **, please boost!Abundant Intelligences is an ambitious research program exploring how to integrate Indigenous Knowledges and AI. They are are looking to fill two full time positions: Senior Program Manager and Finance Manager.See here: www.indigenous-ai.net/abundant-jobs.

item.title: david allen green
item.description: I am sorry to those who came over here with me in November in the hope and expectation that a good chunk of legal Twitter would also come.Sadly most of the accounts I recommended as they came over then are now fairly quiet on here - many not having posted since December/January.Am looking out for other legal accounts to recommend - and if you know of any, do let me know.Any area of law, any jurisdiction.

item.title: TJ McIntyre
item.description: Everyone's talking about today's huge CJEU judgment and what it means for Meta.But there are massive implications for digital evidence in criminal matters also.Paras.124-139 rule out any argument that platforms may retain data for future sharing with police in criminal investigations without an explicit legal requirement to do so, while also providing that legitimate interest is not a general basis for voluntary sharing of data with police.1/2

item.title: Alex Stamos
item.description: This is an excellent piece by @drewharwell with analysis from @jsrailton.A perfect demonstration of why destroying the authentication value of the blue check mark was such a huge mistake, and an unfortunate preview of the kind of rage-baiting that is going to dominate our political sphere in 2024.https://www.washingtonpost.com/technology/2023/07/04/twitter-erica-marsh-suspended/

item.title: clifff 🪿
item.description: Meta’s new app “Threads” is up pre-order in the App Store. Let’s do a quick check on what data they want from you compared to the official Mastodon app, Mammoth and Ivory.Spoiler: Meta wants to know and track everything about you, and Mastodon doesn’t want anything.#threads
